tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE security_configurations (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_name TEXT,
    device_type TEXT,
    software_version TEXT,
    security_protocol TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE security_configurations (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    device_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    device_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    security_level INT NOT NULL,
    last_update TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE application_settings (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    app_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    app_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    setting_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    setting_value TEXT,
    last_modified TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE security_configurations(
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_name VARCHAR(255),
    ip_address VARCHAR(15),
    port INT,
    security_protocol VARCHAR(50)
);

CREATE TABLE network_devices(
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_name VARCHAR(255),
    device_type VARCHAR(50),
    location VARCHAR(255),
    is_active BOOLEAN
);

CREATE TABLE application_settings(
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    app_name VARCHAR(255),
    version VARCHAR(50),
    setting_name VARCHAR(100),
    setting_value TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE network_devices (
    device_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_name VARCHAR(255),
    ip_address VARCHAR(255),
    port INT,
    status BOOLEAN
);

CREATE TABLE device_settings (
    setting_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_id INT,
    setting_name VARCHAR(255),
    setting_value VARCHAR(255),
    CONSTRAINT fk_device FOREIGN KEY (device_id) REFERENCES network_devices(device_id)
);

CREATE TABLE security_settings (
 setting_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 device_id INT NOT NULL,
 setting_name TEXT NOT NULL,
 setting_value TEXT NOT NULL,
 FOREIGN KEY (device_id) REFERENCES security_devices(device_id)
);

CREATE TABLE applications (
 app_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 app_name TEXT NOT NULL,
 app_description TEXT,
 app_version TEXT NOT NULL,
 app_vendor TEXT NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE app_settings (
 app_setting_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 app_id INT NOT NULL,
 setting_name TEXT NOT NULL,
 setting_value TEXT NOT NULL,
 FOREIGN KEY (app_id) REFERENCES applications(app_id)
);

CREATE TABLE user_permissions (
 user_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 device_id INT NOT NULL,
 app_id INT NOT NULL,
 permission_level INT NOT NULL,
 FOREIGN KEY (device_id) REFERENCES security_devices(device_id),
 FOREIGN KEY (app_id) REFERENCES applications(app_id)
);
